values.alignmentText: For families based in Edinburgh, Enterprise, fintech, and public-sector demand keeps .NET roles plentiful in London, Manchester, and Leeds, giving Trey steady options.

values.key: View of Them by Neighboring Countries
values.alignmentText: For families based in Edinburgh, Neighbors respect UK culture but criticise Brexit-era politics, which the family should expect to hear while travelling.
For families based in Edinburgh, Skilled Worker and Global Talent routes are viable but expensive, and Innovator Founder demands robust business plans.
For families based in Edinburgh, Shared language and cultural ties make Americans broadly welcome, especially in cosmopolitan cities.
Living amid Enlightenment architecture with instant access to festivals and Highlands hikes fits our love of culture and nature.
Winters average 1–6 °C (34–43 °F); damp chill and short daylight need cozy routines and maybe a SAD lamp.
For families based in Edinburgh, Contracts target 37.5–40 hours and flex arrangements are common, yet finance and game studios still expect overtime around launches.
For families based in Edinburgh, Hybrid norms, 28+ days of leave, and cultural respect for evenings help Sarah secure calmer schedules, though crunch remains in some London studios.
For families based in Edinburgh, Holiday pay, sick leave, and union protections exceed US baselines, though zero-hour contracts linger in retail and hospitality.

Meaningful swings appear a few times per season; we budget extra time and gear to handle sudden cold snaps or storm systems. Seasonal Weather at 6/10 and Natural Disasters at 8/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for seasonal extremes & variability.

Deep winter gloom lasts several weeks, so we plan strict routines, supplements, and possible getaways to maintain morale. Seasonal Weather at 6/10 and Environment at 8/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for seasonal sunlight hours.

Roughly half the year is wonderful, half demands planning around heat, cold, or rain to enjoy time outside. Seasonal Weather at 6/10 and Environment at 8/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for pleasant weather windows.

Lower-income families can make it work but face long waitlists or limited options in desirable neighborhoods. Minimum Wage at 7/10, Housing Situation at 6/10, and Childcare Support (Citizens) at 7/10 steer the family toward a strong outlook for quality of life – lower-income tier.

Housing and childcare strain the budget, limiting savings and discretionary spending most months. Typical Software Salaries at 6/10, Housing Situation at 6/10, and Work-Life Balance at 7/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for quality of life – middle-income tier.

Affluent households encounter noticeable friction—specialists, tutors, or clubs are scarce or highly gated. Housing Situation at 6/10, Private Education at 5/10, and Family Life at 8/10 steer the family toward a mixed outlook for quality of life – higher-income tier.
